intro: Biscutella didyma var. eriocarpa, commonly known as the woolly biscuitroot, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant has ovate, toothed leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Its root system is fibrous and often forms a compact, rounded mass. This species is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
